website_summaries.verdict: The Logitech diNovo for Notebooks looks sexy and is comfortable for typing, but it's a pricey upgrade for a keyboard that lacks integrated USB ports and backlit keys.
cons: lacks illuminated keys and integrated USB ports

customer_reviews.title: Hit and Miss in terms of functionality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in 2009 for $50 when it was on sale. Shame on me for not trying it out when I first received it, but I ended up finally starting to use about a year ago. It was great for the first 6 or so months. Then I got the same problem that everyone else was getting with the 'a', 's', 1, 2, 3 keys not working. You can search google for the problem, apparently it's pretty common. Unfortunately for me warranty already expired. I'm glad I only paid $50 for it, but for such light use and such short duration, it was very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Could have Been 5*
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for over a year with minor use. The only issues I had: 1.) The reception was sometimes spotty in registering clicks. The receptor was at ye level in the back of my desktop standing 5 feet away. 2.) The spacebar rarely was recognized when typing from the *SIDE* of the spacebar. Tremendous mistake by Logitech designers. 3.) After a year of limited use, certain keys on the upper left had corner of the KB just suddenly stopped working. On a positive note, Logitech Customer Service took care of my defective KB under the warranty plan when the keys stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Light and Simple Wireless Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The Lenovo keyboard is a very simple functional wireless keyboard. I purchased this as an accessory for my laptop.It has great connectivity via a small USB receiver. Alot of people have complained about the absence of a numlock funtion-however I find it less complex to have a simple numberpad-which is what this actually is. It is lightweight and does not have to be line of sight so moving around with my keyboard while my laptop is sitting on a stand does not result in a lack of reliability. It has made surfing from my couch much easier. I recommend this product to anyone who doesn't want their laptop actually in their lap to use it!
customer_reviews.author: KitKat

customer_reviews.title: Nice but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: The materials, the build quality, and the overall design of the product are great. Basically it works well, and it looks nice. Even the packaging was slick. Still, the price tag is a little heavy, considering there are wireless keyboards out there offering the same functionality for less money. if looks are important to you, then you'll find this worth every penny - which I do, but if you are simply looking for a functional wireless keyboard, there are cheaper alternatives. if you have the extra cash to spare, then I'd recommend it - it looks great, and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey B

customer_reviews.title: A good quality keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard for my wife to replace a wired standard counterpart. It is responsive (played COD5 game several times), and heavier than my dell standard keyboard. The finish looks premium. It has lower profile and doesn't take too much space. I did not install the driver shipped with it since it has no problem in both Vista 32bit (on a laptop) and Win7 RC 64bit (on a desktop). I only test it within 6 ft. My wife uses it lightly (just for web surfing and emails) and about 3 months. So I don't know the durability. If you buy this at a reasonable price (<= $30), you cannot go wrong with it.
customer_reviews.author: Limin Yang

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless keyboard--wish I would have bought another one
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Logitech diNovo Keyboard for Notebooks just because it was supposed to have good wireless range and I got a great deal on it ($20 after rebate). It still works great more than 4 years later. What I like: - great range (20+ feet) - sleek and compact - well-built - full-size key layout What I don't like: - expensive at full retail price - no longer available :(
customer_reviews.author: igen

customer_reviews.title: Thin and sleek keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard for my HTPC in the living room. It's a keyboard that I don't mind leaving out because it is sleek. I pair this wireless keyboard with my Logitech Nano VX mouse on the end table. Sometimes it's hard to type with this keyboard on my lap, but my biggest qualm about this is the battery life. It's rated for 3 years, but it didn't last that long. I don't know how Logitech tested the keyboard to allow the batteries to last 3 years. I picked this up months ago during the rebate which made it a deal impossible to pass up.
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: Great little keyboard for home media application.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great little wireless keyboard. It's small and I keep it on my bedside table to use with my media pc. I've had it for over 6 months and it's still on the first set of batteries. The buttons have great feel like most logitech stuff. The keypad feels like a good laptop keyboard. If it had a touch pad it'd be the bomb. It would also be nice if the keys did illuminate. It does feel like a quality piece in your hands, not some super cheap wireless keyboard. I caught it on sale for around $25.
customer_reviews.author: KE4RZ1

customer_reviews.title: Logitech diNovo Keyboard for Notebooks
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, this is the top of the line. I purchased the diNovo Edge because of the excellent typing feel. What was missing was the number pad. When I found this product, the Logitech diNovo Keyboard for Notebooks, I just had to try it. It's just like the diNovo Edge except that the mouse pad is replaced with a numbers pad. Why it's labled for notebooks I haven't a clue. I use this keyboard with my desktop. If you want that same typing experience as you get with a laptop, this is the keyboard for you.
customer_reviews.author: Debbra Ikeler

customer_reviews.title: Very solid keyboard design and build
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is great. I purchased it on 8/24/09, and have lately began to see intermittent radio problems. PRO's: The combination of black gloss plastic and aluminum give it a very high quality look and feel. Its short vertical button travel allows for minimal easy transition from laptop to this keyboard as the two feel very similar. For fifty bucks, its was a great deal. CON's: After 3 years of good use, the keyboard looses connection with the dongle 2-3 times per week.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy

customer_reviews.title: wonderful design, but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: wonderful design, but poor quality. eventually a number of keys just stopped working. poor quality considering it is from logitech. also, if you play any computer games, this keyboard will not work well. it does not like or respond when you push multiple keys at once. it just won't do anything. very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: GGGG

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard - a little spendy but works great for me
customer_reviews.text: Certainly not a fast types or anything, the board is payed out nice, good ergonomics, not really sure about that but it kinda sounded cool, once someone sees the board they always need to score one, bunch of clients have these rigs and they all like them, probably 5 deep, I did have one die which was suprising so manned up and replaced no choice, I like the brand for other things as well.
customer_reviews.author: M Thompson

customer_reviews.title: S and A keys died
customer_reviews.text: When this keyboard worked, it was everything I had hoped for and more. The keys had the perfect amount of tension, the spacing was impeccable, and the wrist rest was comfortable and stylish. Also, the wireless connectivity was good for my small room. But about 6 months in of light use (never left my desk), the S and A keys slowly started to malfunction. For a keyboard this price, it is ridiculous. I've switched back to a cheap $10 dell keyboard that can be dropped and stepped on with no ill effects. If you want to repurchase a keyboard every 6 months to a year, then this is the keyboard for you. For everyone else, stay away!
customer_reviews.author: KeyofAnton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. Feels great typing on and is so slim and compact. The only minor issues are 1) Size of the F-keys is kinda small 2) Position of the delete/home/end/etc keys are non-traditional as well. Still getting used to this. I really like the calculator button though. I haven't made any use of the alternate function keys thus far but I'm sure I will later down the road.
customer_reviews.author: j.lee

customer_reviews.title: Get used to it...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this keyboard for a couple of weeks now and like it. One thing i would like to add to other's comments is that the reason it is called 'for notebooks' seems to be because it is a little smaller than most desktop keyboards. By smaller I mean that the keys are smaller, or maybe closer together, or something!? Anyhow, just understand that it may take you a while to get used to the new spacing of the letters.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Really great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've had the keyboard for about a month now and I'm loving it, its sleek and solid. I only have one con on the keyboard, sometimes when it sits for awhile it must turn itself off or something, because it won't type anything. I have the logitech revolution mouse too and it works all the time great, but I have to turn on and off the keyboard, sometimes multiple times, for it to type again. This only happens on a rare occasion but I thought it was worth mentioning, other than that the keyboard is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: RIP my favorite keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for home use several years ago, and shortly after another for work. This is the best-"feeling" keyboard I've ever typed on. 5 stars. However, now I'm faced with the same "fluttering" on/off power problem that others have noted. I can get it to stay on with some fiddling, but I actually tried to take it apart this morning and it's not simple at all. I've used this keyboard for thousands if not tens of thousands of hours so I can't really complain that it's beginning to fail, but I wish it weren't, and I it hadn't been discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Returned item
customer_reviews.text: Letter "V" popped off with in a couple of days. Although I don't use the letter "V" often, when you need it there is no substitute, such as sending email to my wife. Keyboard quickly became useless. Return through Amazon was great. Quick acceptance, quick credit. Excellent retailer. Less than excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: D. W. Lunt

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I ever had in my life!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this keyboard. Most of keyboards today have a lot of useless keys that only occupies the real estate space making space and control keys crammed, but this one is simple and clean. The keyboard looks slim and sexy. I am using it for desktop PC, don't know why they are emphasizing as for notebook though. You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Old Regular Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still enjoyed the time but now on to better things
customer_reviews.text: Just recently replaced this after 6 years. Had lost a few keys due to taking it for travel and mishandling and the keyboard starting having trouble with batteries even with new ones. Still enjoyed the time but now on to better things.
customer_reviews.author: Blandford

customer_reviews.title: Great for notebook users
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is excellent for those who have grown accustomed to the shallow key depth and narrow key spacing of laptops. The keys feel very similar to my old Dell E1505, which I had typed many a papers on. I have since upgraded to a thinkpad T400, and despite the legendary keyboard quality, I manage to still type faster and more accurately on this keyboard while working at home. Only complaint would be the gloss black trim around the keyboard which attract finger prints quite easily. The wrist rest is COLD upon initial use, but does warm up and is kinda refreshing on a hot day.
customer_reviews.author: Mondi

customer_reviews.title: Description should say "Perfect for Desktops"
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, its about time, perfect keyboard. Keys are light and easy to use, layout is perfect, programmable function keys are great. Just wish I wouldn't have waited so long to purchase! If your looking for a wireless keyboard, desktop or laptop, this is your keyboard...you will not be disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Everett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those that love laptop keyboards..
customer_reviews.text: but wish they were a bit bigger. And has the numbers pad to the right (10 key?) I got so used to my laptop keyboard that I couldn't use my old wired keyboard anymore when I put my laptop on a dock. This keyboard is great. Very stylish and great to type on. Comfortable. The only gripe would be that I occasionally press the eject button when I'm going for backspace or that sometimes when pressing alt I'll hit the windows key, but, that's probably more my problem. Overall, I am extremely happy with my purchase and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Becks

customer_reviews.title: Awsome wireless keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few weeks ago with the [...] rebate, so getting a [...] keyboard for [...] is a exceptional bargin. I have this on a desktop and it works great at over 15 ft. away with no lag time and fantastic options. Very highly recommended for a wireless from Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D. Hauge

customer_reviews.title: simply elegant
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard. The price may not have appealed to me but I was able to get a rebate and actually received it already. SO the keyboard was a great price. But even if I didn't get the rebate, I'd still be very happy with this. I love the look and feel of it.
customer_reviews.author: Aamna Kuwe

customer_reviews.title: crowded keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It's the nice keyboard. The piano finish just design for finger prints. I am a touched typist (over 90wpm). I always hit the Function key when typing numbers. Finally returned it and bought the Logitech 920-000914 Black Wired Ultra-thin Illuminated Keyboard. It has a even better typing feel.
customer_reviews.author: T. Cheung

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Relatively lightweight - Long range - Silent keystrokes - Sips battery Cons: - Unreliable in my experience Neutral: - It's definitely not a petite keyboard Like some of the other reviewers here, I had a problem with keys that stopped working after a while. If you're under warrantee, Logitech will replace the keyboard, but it's definitely something to consider when buying it.
customer_reviews.author: TeeKay

customer_reviews.title: Loved it, but keys stopped working, Logitech to replace within 5 yr warranty
customer_reviews.text: Favorite keyboard, loved the sleek design and key feel and response. Purchased 2009. Selected keys stopped working 2013. Same keys as many customers reported CAPS LOCK,a,s,1,2,3 on top row and 8 on num keypad [...] Called customer support who walked through a few test steps before creating an incident and offering replacement with the K800 Illuminated Keyboard since this model is no longer made.
customer_reviews.author: LIZ

customer_reviews.title: not durable
customer_reviews.text: This WAS a decent keyboard but the most used keys such as "S" and "A" stopped working after about 9 months. It's not acceptable for a keyboard costing over $100 to break down under light use in less than a year. We don't need more disposable garbage and planned obsolescence. No.
customer_reviews.author: oberon

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Using this keyboard right now after 2+ years. Still works flawlessly. Keys occasionally need to be cleaned, but that's unavoidable with crumbs unless you get a chiclet style keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: pdinc

customer_reviews.title: pretty good for the price after rebate
customer_reviews.text: Keys are very quiet even I can't hear while typing apart from that damm space key which makes more noise (that's why 4 stars) price is great after rebate and love the size of keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: fungame

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. I have one at my home office and one at my office.
customer_reviews.author: DanaSue

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid performance
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is completely reliable and the battery has lasted several years -- well past the 2 year forecast! Logitech did this one well!
customer_reviews.author: David Song

customer_reviews.title: it works the way they say...
customer_reviews.text: gotta love the looks.. it maches perfectly my aluminum macbook pro!!! it's not that quiet as they say but it's not as noisy as a regular keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: P. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Got it at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Been watching this keyboard on amazon for a while until I grabbed it when the price dropped to $49 with a $30 rebate. So far I'm happy with it. All the keys are silent, except the space bar. It make a little clatter, but exceptable. Overall, the quality is very decent & I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is clicky and works perfectly well. Not quite a good as my dinovo edge, which i use with my HTPC, but this wireless keyboard is solid. I've been using this keyboard for 2 years and it has zero issues. Would give this keyboard an extra 1/2 star if there was the option.
customer_reviews.author: sfuboy

customer_reviews.title: very happy
customer_reviews.text: We love this keyboard. The number pad is important to us. It is easy to type on. It also looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Lael A. Fruen

customer_reviews.title: Stylish keyboard for less
customer_reviews.text: Very slim keyboard with quiet keys. Initially I had problems with the S/W setup as few of the keys didn't work (Function keys didn't work). I had Intellitype S/W (Microsoft KB/Mouse combo) and un-installed it and long behold, everything started working fine. So far I'm happy w/ the purchase, especially [...] after the rebate.
customer_reviews.author: textech007

customer_reviews.title: GOOd investment
customer_reviews.text: this is a great wireless keyboard great for all types of computers/laptops. all you require is a usb drive and your basically set. My friends showed me this item i bought it. For the price, its well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is really really amazing keyboard. Got it just for $[...] after mail-in rebate offer from Logitech. This keyboard is not only slim & sexy but has very good time response. Amazing product...
customer_reviews.author: Deepanshu Arora

customer_reviews.title: excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Logitech is one of the kind. Pros: good shape, good touch, connecting stable Cons: a little dent when delivered, F-keys a little small (kind of same problems for other logitech keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: G. Yang

customer_reviews.title: super
customer_reviews.text: Everything went well, expectations, cheeping, product is nice, clean like new. love it love it love it love it Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Gilles Stephanus

customer_reviews.title: Keys A and S died after one year of regular use.
customer_reviews.text: This was a fantastic keyboard until keys A and S died completely after one year of regular use. and I am not the only one who had this problem with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: MHND HKL

customer_reviews.title: It's better than I think
customer_reviews.text: This is my first wireless keyboard and it's better than I think. It's very easy to install and use, or even if you don't install the driver, it also work will on windows.
customer_reviews.author: Yi Zheng

customer_reviews.title: excellent key board for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price after rebate. More sturdy than it looks. Small footprints is perfect for small desktop space.
customer_reviews.author: hibindo

customer_reviews.title: great remote keyboard
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for a desktop, it feels a little bit tiny for a man, but it's great for gals, then i use it for my ps3's remote typing, and i love it. bought this with the promotion ending up cost only $20, the rebate from logitech came really fast. and i love the feel of the logitech feel for keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: I. He

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is great. Everything seems to be working perfectly, and I love the design of it.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Not lasting
customer_reviews.text: Very sleek looking. But, typing lags when idle and then start repeating itself - annoying! The frustration outweighs the benefits.
customer_reviews.author: Disappointed

customer_reviews.title: BAD KEYBOARD
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has been discontinued by Logitech and it is a good thing as it is a piece of junk. The new ones we received were all new defective. I do not recommend this keyboard at all.
customer_reviews.author: T.E.O.S., INC.

customer_reviews.title: Return from Shoptronics was a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived damaged. After setting it up, I find that one of the keys doesn't work. Shoptronics return policy is a complete hassle. I would not buy from this company.
customer_reviews.author: travel

product_meta.title: Logitech diNovo Keyboard for Notebooks
product_meta.description: Engineered for comfort and designed for beauty, the diNovo Keyboard features a wireless modular design that combines easily with a notebook stand and mouse to help you type and work in a more natural position for improved comfort. The modern, elegant styling is accented by an ultra-slim profile, glossy black finish, and brushed aluminum ¿ and a full-size number pad. The PerfectStroke key system provides more key travel than typical notebook keyboards, so every keystroke is comfortable, fluid, and silent. Three-year battery life minimizes the hassle of replacing batteries, while Logitech 2.4 GHz wireless technology provides a powerful and reliable connection.
feature_bullets: Modular design that combines easily with a notebook stand and mouse for added comfort
Modern, elegant styling accented by glossy black and brushed aluminum
PerfectStroke key system for typing that silent, natural and fluid
Battery life up to 3 years and low-battery indicator to help eliminate surprises
Advanced 2.4 GHz wireless technology for more robust, reliable performance

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars103 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
